reviewText: I think this IS one of Carlin's finer shows. The beginning is outrageous as Carlin explains the language he will not be using for the show, and the routine that follows ("Life's Little Moments") had me in stitches for weeks especially when he describes shaking hands with someone who's missing a few fingers. Carlin goes on to one of his many routines about dogs, expresses his thoughts on cancer, talks about stupid people, the humorous side of rape, feminists, blowjobs, prostitution, his good ideas (Including the Sony S***man), things we never see or hear, things we don't want to hear, organ donor programs, comatose, and ends with a tight discussion on words and euphemisms. All the while making his traditional goofy faces and voices which just add to the laughs. This is a very entertaining special and comes recommended.
summary: Ignore the other review here. This one was great!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Yes, another HBO special.This one irritated me at times, but that is of course the point. He talks about words, things you're not supposed to say, and things you're supposed to say. A fairly long part is about feminists, which made me uncomfortable. But it is certainly true that some feminists take themselves way too seriously. One of the best parts was about euphemisms. Maybe a little more anger in this one than some of the earlier ones.

reviewText: I was clicking through the channels last night at around 1 AM and happened upon this on HBO.  I could not stop laughing!  I'm surprised I didn't wake my wife up who was sleeping upstairs.  I thought this was such an excellent show that I had to buy it to show my wife.  I know I will want to see this over and over.  I know she'll love it too.  This is a brilliant, articulate man.  He tells us about the bizarre and hillarious things that he thinks about during the day.
summary: I saw this on Cable last night and had to buy it

reviewText: Watching these shows now after his untimely death, I appreciate them even more. Not only are they funny, they are completely engrossing as you watch a master at work! This is another great thought provoking set! One of his best. Like a fine wine, George got better with age. I pictured him perfoming well into his 80's!R.I.P. GeorgeYou will be missed.
